commitResults.messageTitle: Added inputs for Duke and made Duke repeat the input.
Added list functionality and adding items to list
Added mark feature to mark tasks as done or undone
Added categories feature to tasks. Added Event.java, Todo.java, Deadline.java. Separated queries in to Query.java
Added automated text UI testing
Added error handling features when there is a missing description for tasks or invalid commands
Added delete task feature
Added save functionality to duke.txt
Added functionality to understand dates and times.
Refactored code to include more OOP
Organised classes into packages
Added gradle support
Added JUnit test cases for testing.
Added JavaDoc comments to public methods
Edited code to follow coding standard
Edited code to follow coding standards.
Worked on Find Command
Added Find Tasks functionality
Added Launcher.java
Added a GUI via JavaFX for Duke
No assertions are utilised in the codebase.
commitResults.messageBody:
Assertions should be used liberally for testing to spot potential bugs quickly

Let's add assertions,
* To Duke.java to ensure that file text is loaded for loading and savings tasks.
* To AddCommand.java to ensure that task is successfully in task list
* To DeleteCommand.java to ensure that task is successfully removed from task list
* To TaskList.java to ensure that commands are successfully marked and unmarked.

commitResults.messageTitle: Some Command methods were unnecessarily long and cluttered.
commitResults.messageBody:
Let's rectify these comments by updating their methods.
Let's remove the QueryType class to fit into the Query class

commitResults.messageTitle: Find command: make matching case insensitive and matches to dates
commitResults.messageBody:
Find functionality is case sensitive, and only matches to tasks description.

A case insensitive find is more user-friendly because users cannot be expected to remember exact case of keywords.
A find feature that matches dates is more user-friendly for users to see what events and deadlines they have on that day.

Let's,
* update the search algorithm to use case-insensitive matching
* update the search algorithm to match dates in the form <yyyy-MM-dd> or <MMM dd yyyy>

commitResults.messageTitle: Find Command: Bug fixes with regards to matching dates
commitResults.messageBody:
Find Command contains bugs when keying in dates of different formats.

Let's,
* Update the find command so that it can take in dates <yyyy-MM-dd> or <MMM-dd-yyyy>

commitResults.messageTitle: Update README.md
commitResults.messageBody: Added user guide for Duke chatbot, mainly the list of features that can be used as well as their formats.
